items.title: Cannabis Events Come Out of Hiding in New York City
items.abstract: As New Yorkers wait for marijuana sales to be legalized, some small businesses are putting down roots.

items.title: Warming Effect of Urban Activities Felt Widely
items.abstract: Scientists studying weather and energy consumption have found that activities from urban areas can warm the air by nearly 2 degrees as far as 1,000 miles away.

items.title: Only 9 Chinese Cities Pass Clean Air Test
items.abstract: Nine out of 161 monitored cities met Chinaâ€™s new air quality standards in the first half of this year, the Ministry of Environmental Protection said.

items.title: An Arid Arizona City Manages Its Thirst
items.abstract: There is a certain curiosity about the way water is used in Phoenix, which gets barely eight inches of rain a year but is not necessarily parched.

items.title: New York Bans Alcohol Ads on Most City Property
items.abstract: Citing the health risk to young people and vulnerable populations, the city announced the ban that could lead to a loss of $3 million in yearly advertising fees.
